content.raw:
/usr/include/ruby-2.5.0/ruby/missing.h:180:24: note: suggested alternative: 'isfinite'
     #   define isfinite(x) finite(x)

Looks like this ruby bug [https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/12417](https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/12417)

Is it possible to do

```c
#undef isfinite 
```

after including ruby headers? The advantage is the workaround is only in one place, not that the changes here are very big.
content.html:
/usr/include/ruby-2.5.0/ruby/missing.h:180:24: note: suggested alternative: 'isfinite'
 #   define isfinite(x) finite(x)

Looks like this ruby bug https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/12417

Is it possible to do

#undef isfinite

after including ruby headers? The advantage is the workaround is only in one place, not that the changes here are very big.

pullrequest.title: Fix compilation using gcc8 and add support for c++17

content.raw:
Sorry, I didn’t see this one when I went ahead and fixed.  I looked in the file that @sloretz mentioned above and saw this stanza:

    #ifndef isfinite
    #ifndef HAVE_ISFINITE
    #define HAVE_ISFINITE 1
    #define isfinite(x) finite(x)
    #endif
    #endif

‌

My understanding is that including `cmath` would make the `isfinite` symbol defined, but there may be something strange going on here, so I just pre-defined `HAVE_ISFINITE`.  

The other part of my PR was just Swig trickery to make sure that comes at the beginning of the generated code.

‌
content.html:
Sorry, I didn’t see this one when I went ahead and fixed. I looked in the file that @sloretz mentioned above and saw this stanza:

#ifndef isfinite
#ifndef HAVE_ISFINITE
#define HAVE_ISFINITE 1
#define isfinite(x) finite(x)
#endif
#endif

‌

My understanding is that including cmath would make the isfinite symbol defined, but there may be something strange going on here, so I just pre-defined HAVE_ISFINITE.

The other part of my PR was just Swig trickery to make sure that comes at the beginning of the generated code.

‌

pullrequest.title: Fix compilation using gcc8 and add support for c++17

content.raw:
I had to update the `update-alternatives` line to create a symlink to gcov-8. The coverage output from gcc8 has changed, and requires a newer lcov. Pipelines now installs lcov from source. 

The bash script from [codecov.io](http://codecov.io) doesn’t seem to like the new coverage output. I’ve disabled [codecov.io](http://codecov.io) in pipelines.
content.html:
I had to update the update-alternatives line to create a symlink to gcov-8. The coverage output from gcc8 has changed, and requires a newer lcov. Pipelines now installs lcov from source.

The bash script from codecov.io doesn’t seem to like the new coverage output. I’ve disabled codecov.io in pipelines.
